title.narrative: 2.1 NUTRITION ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: Strengthened and functional multisector humanitarian and development coordination mechanisms are in place and evidence-based, equity-focused nutrition policies, code strategies and plans are developed and/or reviewed., which contributes to Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased proportions of girls and boys under the age of 5 years and women have equitable access to and use essential services and adopt optimal nutrition practices to reduce all forms of malnutrition, with a focus on vulnerable Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and emergency- affected communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened and functional multisector humanitarian and development coordination mechanisms are in place and evidence-based,equity-focused nutrition policies, code strategies and plans are developed and/or reviewed.

description.narrative: UNICEF, Government and partners reached 95% of districts with the Basic Nutrition Service Package (BNSP); an increase from about 65% coverage in 2017. Somalia launched the National Nutrition Strategy (2021-2025), aligned to National Development Plan (NDP) and SDGs and the Micronutrient Survey that supported evidence-based policy decision-making. UNICEF supported capacity building for the SUN movement, humanitarian coordination and multi-stakeholder platforms now exist at National and state levels. UNICEF provided financial and technical assistance to the Federal Ministry of Health (FMOH) to update the Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition (IMAM) guidelines that incorporated latest evidence critical for IMAM. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:04/01/2021
